class.name: jsx3.gui.Block
class.text: This class provides a container-based, object-oriented approach to creating static html objects (basically this class creates "DIV" objects). This class is useful for creating objects as simple as 'labels' that can be placed anywhere on the screen. The advantage to using this class instead of trying to insert static html in the html window is that it allows the given HTML string to be managed by the 'container-management' strategy employed by the JSX Architecture

param.name: strName
param.text: unique name distinguishing this object from all other JSX GUI objects in the JSX application

param.name: vntLeft
param.text: either a number (i.e, 12, 30, etc) or a number and a unit value (i.e., "25%", "36pt", etc); if a number is passed, pixels will be the assumed unit when painted to screen

param.name: vntTop
param.text: either a number (i.e, 12, 30, etc) or a number and a unit value (i.e., "25%", "36pt", etc); if a number is passed, pixels will be the assumed unit when painted to screen

param.name: vntWidth
param.text: either a number (i.e, 12, 30, etc) or a number and a unit value (i.e., "25%", "36pt", etc); if a number is passed, pixels will be the assumed unit when painted to screen

param.name: vntHeight
param.text: either a number (i.e, 12, 30, etc) or a number and a unit value (i.e., "25%", "36pt", etc); if a number is passed, pixels will be the assumed unit when painted to screen

param.name: strHTML
param.text: Text/HTML markup to place in the jsx3.gui.Block instance

method.name: getBackground

return.text: valid CSS property for the background such as: background-image:url(x.gif); or background-image:url(x.gif);background-repeat:no-repeat;

method.text: Returns valid CSS property value for the background such as: background-image:url(x.gif); or background-image:url(x.gif);background-repeat:no-repeat;

method.name: getBackgroundColor

return.text: valid CSS property value, (e.g., red, #ffffff, rgb(255,0,0))

method.text: Returns valid CSS property value, (e.g., red, #ffffff, rgb(255,0,0))

method.name: getBorder
method.text: Returns CSS property value(s) for a border (border: solid 1px #000000)

method.name: getCDFAttribute
method.text: Returns the named attribute on the CDF record to which this object is mapped.

method.name: getCDFId
method.text: Returns the CDF ID of the record to map to.

method.name: getCSSOverride
method.text: Returns CSS text to override the standard instance properties on the painted object.

method.name: getClassName
method.text: Returns the named CSS rule(s) to apply to the painted object.

method.name: getColor

return.text: valid CSS property value, (e.g., red, #ffffff, rgb(255,0,0))

method.text: Returns valid CSS property value, (e.g., red, #ffffff, rgb(255,0,0))

method.name: getCursor
method.text: Returns valid CSS property value, (e.g., default,wait,col-resize); if no value or an empty string, null is returned

method.name: getDimensions
method.text: Returns the dimensions in an array of four int values

method.name: getDisplay
method.text: Returns the CSS display for the object; one of jsx3.gui.Block.DISPLAYNONE (display:none;) and jsx3.gui.Block.DISPLAYBLOCK (display:;)

method.name: getFontName
method.text: Returns the CSS font-family for the object

method.name: getFontSize
method.text: Returns the CSS font-size for the object

method.name: getFontWeight
method.text: Returns the CSS font-weight for the object ("bold" or "normal")

method.name: getHeight
method.text: Returns the height property of this object.

method.name: getIndex
method.text: Returns IE tab index for setting the tabIndex property for the on-screen DHTML for the object

method.name: getLeft
method.text: Returns the left property of this object.

method.name: getMargin
method.text: Returns CSS property value(s) for a margin (margin:4px;)

method.name: getOverflow
method.text: Returns the overflow property for the object, that defines how its on-screen view will behave when its contents are larger than its specified width and/or height

method.name: getPadding
method.text: Returns CSS property value(s) for a padding (padding:4px;)

method.name: getRelativePosition
method.text: Returns if the instance is relatively positioned on-screen; returns one of: jsx3.gui.Block.ABSOLUTE jsx3.gui.Block.RELATIVE

method.name: getTagName
method.text: Returns HTML tag name to use when rendering the object on-screen (span is the default); if the property is null, jsx3.gui.Block.DEFAULTTAGNAME is used;

method.name: getText
method.text: Returns the text/HTML for the control to be displayed on-screen; returns an empty string if null; since the text is rendered on-screen as browser-native HTML, the equivalent of an empty tag (e.g., ) would be an enclosing tag with an empty string (no content): . To return null would be equivalent to null, which is not the same as

method.name: getTextAlign
method.text: Returns the CSS text-align property for the object; if no property value exists, jsx3.gui.Block.ALIGNLEFT is returned by default

method.name: getTip
method.text: Returns the tooltip text to display when the object is hovered over.

method.name: getTop
method.text: Returns the top property of this object.

method.name: getVisibility
method.text: Returns the visibility property for the object

method.name: getWidth
method.text: Returns the width property of this object.

method.name: getZIndex
method.text: Returns the CSS z-index property

method.name: hideMask
method.text: Removes the "blocking" mask inside the block to stop user interactions with existing content

method.name: paint

param.name: strData
param.text: Text/HTML markup that will replace value of getText() during paint—typically passed by subclass, JSXBlockX after it performs an XML/XSL merge to acquire its data; for memory management purposes, the data is not set via setText() and, instead, is passed as a temporary input parameter, as the object's model would contain the text for no reason

method.text: Returns the DHTML, used for this object's on-screen view

method.name: setBackground

param.name: strBG
param.text: valid CSS property value for the background such as: background-image:url(x.gif); or background-image:url(x.gif);background-repeat:no-repeat;

method.text: Sets valid CSS property value for the background such as: background-image:url(x.gif); or background-image:url(x.gif);background-repeat:no-repeat; returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setBackgroundColor

param.name: strColor
param.text: valid CSS property value, (e.g., red, #ffffff, rgb(255,0,0))

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets valid CSS property value, (e.g., red, #ffffff, rgb(255,0,0)); returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setBorder

param.name: strCSS
param.text: valid CSS property value for a border (border: solid 1px #000000)

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view will be updated with requiring a repaint

method.text: Sets CSS property value(s) for a border (border: solid 1px #000000). Properties can be strung together as in: border:solid 1px #989885;border-left-width:0px;

method.name: setCDFAttribute
method.text: Sets the named attribute on the CDF record to which this object is mapped. Updates to show the new mapped value

method.name: setCDFId

param.name: strCDFId
param.text: If not set, the CDF Id used by the nearest ancestor of type jsx3.gui.CDF will be used.

method.text: Sets the CDF ID of the record to map to. Updates to show the new mapped value

method.name: setCSSOverride

param.name: strCSS
param.text: CSS text. For example, color:red;background-color:orange;

method.text: Sets CSS text to override the standard instance properties on the painted object. Convenience method for extending this object. CSS properties affecting layout, including border-width, padding, margin, width, and height are strongly discouraged, as they may interfere with the framework's internal box models. Since some controls are composited from multiple HTML elements, some styles may not cascade to nested elements. Instance Properties are the preferred method for applying styles.

method.name: setClassName

param.name: strClassName
param.text: CSS property name without the leading "."

method.text: Sets the named CSS rule(s) to apply to the painted object. Rules that specify border-width, padding, margin, width, and height are strongly discouraged. Multiple rules may be specified, delimited with a space. For example, label emphasis. Since some controls are composited from multiple HTML elements, some rule styles may not cascade to nested elements. Dynamic Properties are the preferred method for applying global styles.

method.name: setColor

param.name: strColor
param.text: valid CSS property value, (e.g., red, #ffffff, rgb(255,0,0))

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets valid CSS property value, (e.g., red, #ffffff, rgb(255,0,0)); returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setCursor

param.name: strCursor
param.text: valid CSS property value, (e.g., default,wait,col-resize)

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets valid CSS property value, (e.g., default,wait,col-resize)

method.name: setDimensions

param.name: left
param.text: the new left value or an array containing all four new values

param.name: top
param.text: the new top value

param.name: width
param.text: the new width value

param.name: height
param.text: the new height value

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: whether to update the display of this object immediately. If left is an Array then this parameter is the second parameter passed to this method.

method.text: Set one to four dimensions at once. This operation is more efficient than calling more than one of setLeft, setTop, etc. Any argument can be null to indicate not to update it.

method.name: setDisplay

param.name: DISPLAY
param.text: one of jsx3.gui.Block.DISPLAYNONE or jsx3.gui.Block.DISPLAYBLOCK

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets the display for the object. Note that although the framework uses CSS to apply this setting, the actual values that get set are determined by the system. Only those parameters listed for @DISPLAY are supported as inputs to this function.

method.name: setFontName

param.name: strFontName
param.text: valid CSS font-family property value

method.text: Sets the CSS font-family for the object; returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setFontSize

param.name: intPixelSize
param.text: font-size (in pixels)

method.text: Sets the CSS font-size for the object; returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setFontWeight

param.name: FONTWEIGHT
param.text: [jsx3.gui.Block.FONTBOLD. jsx3.gui.Block.FONTNORMAL]

method.text: Sets the CSS font-weight for the object ("bold" or "normal"); returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setHeight

param.name: vntHeight
param.text: the height as a non-negative integer or non-negative percentage. For example: 45%, 12.

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets the height property of this object.

method.name: setIndex

param.name: intIndex
param.text: any value in the valid range of -32767 to 32767

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets IE tab index for setting the tabIndex property for the on-screen DHTML for the object; returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setLeft

param.name: vntLeft
param.text: the left value. Only numeric values and percentages are supported. For example: 25, -10, 20%.

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if @vntLeft is in integer (a number with no modifier) and @bUpdateView is true, the object's on-screen view is immediately updated to match its model, obviating the need to call '[object].repaint()'

method.text: Sets the left property of this object. The left property specifies the horizontal offset of this object from its parent and only applies if this object is absolutely positioned.

method.name: setMargin

param.name: strCSS
param.text: The preferred method to set margin is by moving clockwise, beginning with the north compass position, without the pixel designation. For example, to specify a top margin of 8 pixels, use 8 0 0 0. CSS syntax is supported, but requires that pixels be designated. For example, using margin:5px;margin-left:10px;, is equivalent to 5 5 5 10.

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view will be updated with requiring a repaint

method.text: Sets CSS property value for margin.

method.name: setOverflow

param.name: OVERFLOW
param.text: [jsx3.gui.Block.OVERFLOWSCROLL, jsx3.gui.Block.OVERFLOWHIDDEN, jsx3.gui.Block.OVERFLOWEXPAND]

method.text: Sets the overflow property for the object, that defines how its on-screen view will behave when its contents are larger than its specified width and/or height; returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setPadding

param.name: strCSS
param.text: The preferred method to set padding is by moving clockwise, beginning with the north compass position, without the pixel designation. For example, to specify a top padding of 8 pixels, use 8 0 0 0. CSS syntax is supported, but requires that pixels be designated. For example, using padding:5px;padding-left:10px;, is equivalent to 5 5 5 10.

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view will be updated without requiring a repaint.

method.text: Sets the CSS property value for padding an object.

method.name: setRelativePosition

param.name: intRelative
param.text: jsx3.gui.Block.RELATIVE will be applied to the view if null. One of: jsx3.gui.Block.RELATIVE jsx3.gui.Block.ABSOLUTE

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets if the jsx3.gui.Block instance is relatively positioned on-screen; returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setTagName

param.name: strTagName
param.text: valid HTML tag name (span, div, form, ol, ul, li, etc); if null is passed, the getter will use jsx3.gui.Block.DEFAULTTAGNAME

method.text: Sets HTML tag name to use when rendering the object on-screen (jsx3.gui.Block.DEFAULTTAGNAME is the default); returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setText

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets the text/HTML for the control to be displayed on-screen; returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setTextAlign

param.name: ALIGN
param.text: one of: jsx3.gui.Block.ALIGNLEFT, jsx3.gui.Block.ALIGNRIGHT, jsx3.gui.Block.ALIGNCENTER

method.text: Sets the CSS text-align property for the object; returns reference to self to facilitate method chaining;

method.name: setTip

param.name: strTip
param.text: the tip text.

method.text: Sets the tooltip text to display when the object is hovered over; updates the model and the view immediately. Note that the tip text is rendered natively by the browser and that the behavior may vary between browsers. Some browsers may honor line breaks in the text and some may have a maximum length that then show before truncating the tip. For more consistent rendering across browsers use the SPYGLASS event instead.

method.name: setTop

param.name: vntTop
param.text: the top value. Only numeric values and percentages are supported. For example: 25, -10, 20%.

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets the top property of this object. The top property specifies the vertical offset of this object from its parent and only applies if this object is absolutely positioned.

method.name: setVisibility

param.name: VISIBILITY
param.text: [jsx3.gui.Block.VISIBILITYVISIBLE, jsx3.gui.Block.VISIBILITYHIDDEN]

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets the CSS visibility property the object

method.name: setWidth

param.name: vntWidth
param.text: the width as non-negative integer or non-negative percentage. For example: 45%, 12.

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets the width property of this object.

method.name: setZIndex

param.name: intZIndex
param.text: z-index value

param.name: bUpdateView
param.text: if true, the view of this object is immediately updated, obviating the need to call repaint().

method.text: Sets the CSS z-index for the object

method.name: showMask

param.name: strMessage
param.text: text/message to display in the blocking mask to tell the user it is disabled

method.text: Displays a "blocking mask" inside the block to stop user interactions with content within the block. Applies only to Blocks. Use only on blocks with no padding and with overflow set to hidden.

method.name: getJSXParent

param.name: objGUI
param.text: HTML element in the view from which to begin looking for the first containing JSX parent in the model

method.text: Returns the first JSX parent (as a JSX instance in the model) of @objGUI (an HTML element in the view); returns null if no jsx parent could be found

method.name: getVersion
method.text: Returns the release/build for the class (i.e., "2.2.00")
